intro: Topobea arboricola, commonly known as the tree heather, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. Its leaves are typically dark green and leathery, adapted to thrive in acidic, well-drained soils. Topobea arboricola is often found in cloud forests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
